channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2588] Laziness (PIC)
item.description: This might be why you are fat.

item.title: [+1859] The end of the Rainbow..(Pic)
[+1688] Ralph Macchio in "Wax On, Fuck Off"
item.description: In his new movie, Ralph Macchio faces his toughest challenge yet becoming a Hollywood bad boy. In order to re-establish himself in the entertainment industry he hits the streets of Los Angeles to show everyone how tough this Karate Kid is.

item.title: [+1451] Chicago Blackhawks are the 2010 Stanley Cup Champions
item.description: The Chicago Blackhawks closed out the Philadelphia Flyers in Game 6 of the Stanley Cup Finals in a tight fought battle at the Wachovia Center in Philadelphia.

item.title: [+1448] I Sold Everything To Buy A Lamborghini, Drive Across Country
item.description: Richard Jordan had everything he was told to want: cars, a new house, and a fiancee. Then his fiancee left him. So he sold everything, bought a Lamborghini Gallardo and set out across America. This is his amazing story.

item.title: [+1198] Radiohead frontman: Music industry on verge of collapse
item.description: Radiohead frontman Thom Yorke is warning the music industry is on the brink of collapse, insisting young musicians should resist signing record deals because the major labels will "completely fold" within months.

item.title: [+1145] Ear Plug Fail [PIC]
[+1100] Salma Hayek Completely Loses It After Seeing A Snake (Video)
item.description: Salma is obviously not a fan of big snakes. You can tell because she climbs on Maya Rudolph’s shoulders to get away from it.

item.title: [+1038] Switching from iPhone to Android
item.description: After three years as a loyal iPhone user, I'm thinking about making the switch to a phone running Google Android. I'm looking for something new, Android is looking good nowadays, and Apple's creepy corporate culture is wearing me down.

item.title: [+1007] Google Adds A Background Image To Its Homepage By Default
item.description: few days ago Google got slightly more Bing-ified when it started allowing users to customize their backgrounds (Bing has featured a rotating photo as its background since it launched). Today, Google is taking that a step further: it’s now featuring a background image by default on its homepage, even for users who haven’t activated the new feature.

item.title: [+972] Judge may dismiss 4,576 of 4,577 P2P defendants from lawsuit
item.description: The federal judge overseeing several of the major new P2P copyright cases has given the lawyers two weeks to convince her that suing 4,577 people in a single lawsuit is proper. Why shouldn't 4,576 of them "be dismissed for misjoinder," she asked?

item.title: [+896] The Evolution Of Man [comic]
item.description: From whence we sprang becomes our trash can.

item.title: [+827] BP, Halliburton & Transocean Skip Hearings On Oil Disaster
item.description: Yesterday, BP wrote a letter saying it wouldn’t be showing up for the three-day hearings this week. ThinkProgress obtained the letter to McCoy, addressed from Margaret D. Laney, BP’s Mississippi Coordinator for Public and Government Affairs. From the letter: I regret that we are unable to accommodate your invitation to participate........

item.title: [+768] Journalist: 'Beneath the Surface, Only Thing I See Is Oil'
item.description: AP journalist Rich Matthews wanted to give people a new way to look at the spill. So he dove in to the Gulf oil spill -- without Hazmat suit -- and taped it.

item.title: [+731] Why did nearly all life on Earth die 250 million years ago?
item.description: Paleontologists call the "Great Dying." Roughly a quarter of a billion years ago, 90-95 percent of all life on Earth died out. It took 30 million years for the planet to recover. Most people are familiar with the extinction event 65 million years ago that wiped out the dinosaurs. But the Great Dying was much more devastating.

item.title: [+731] Playstation 4?
item.description: A YouTube account called SCElabs has posted a pair of PS4 viral videos. Could Sony be gearing up to announce Playstation 4 at E3 next week?

item.title: [+691] IP-Addresses of First Hurt Locker Victims Revealed
item.description: Approximately 700 IP-addresses of BitTorrent users who allegedly shared a copy of ‘The Hurt locker’ have been submitted to the Washington D.C. District Court. The public court records show that nearly all IPs in the group were tracked from the last week of April until the first week of May.

item.title: [+640] 65 Sexy Pictures of World Cup Fans
item.description: Sexy World Cup soccer fans are about as important to the World Cup as soccer itself. Why? Because they’re awesome, that’s why. In honor of the World Cup kicking off this Friday, we proudly present 65 pictures of smoking hot World Cup fans.

item.title: [+607] Is BP Headed for Bankruptcy?
item.description: How low will BP stock go? Today's guess: All the way to zero. Already, the oil spill in the gulf has caused BP shares to drop to $30 from $60. That's a loss in total market value of $90 billion.

item.title: [+603] New Comet Visible in Morning Sky
item.description: A recently discovered comet is surprising sky watchers by becoming brighter than predictions had first suggested and can now be seen with the unaided eye during the next few weeks.
